column4: wtf, i just ran a prog with wine, now i closed it but my screen resolution is now less than ever
so what can i do to view my external usb storage device? :S
it should automatically appear on a ubuntu desktop, check the desktop, click on the icon on the bottom left and that will minimise all windows then you should see something that equates to it
nothing is on :'(
so what version are you using of ubuntu? 4.10 5.04 5.10?
na ,release is 5.10 and breezy was the development version to get there ;-), okay so it should "just work" please start a terminal and type df in it
okay so it is not usually one
okay do this, system, administration, disks
does it appear there? is there a light on it?
I am writing a lot of stuff please wait
okay >>sudo mkdir -p /media/flash<< then >> sudo mount /dev/sdc1 /media/flash/ << then you can access the drive, if that fails add a >>-t umsdos << after the mount and before /
what are you trying to work with, and no don't lol about it I told you eariler
you will be quietened for a little while if you continue, there are 600 + users here and it just is plain bad manners to hit enter time and again, gather your thoughts and issue them forth in one go
look by all means get your problem sorted, but dont hit enter at the end of every half a thought that is all :-)
what is this binary you want to run, and where is it?
read write
can you stop with the continous stream of thought please - it is spamming the channel
put your thoughts together first
can you read this?
no I just want to know that your going to quit spamming the channel, chill
we really did not need that g - its spamming dude take your time
sudo umount
